data.text:
Description

Leather Binding

Translated into English by Alexander Teixeira de Mattos. The second edition of this particular collection. Maurice Polydore Marie Bernard Maeterlinck was a Belgian playwright, poet and essayist. The main themes of Maeterlinck's works are death and the meaning of life.

Condition

In a full calf binding with gilt stamping to the spines. Externally, smart with small patches of slight rubbing to the spine and joints, mostly to the raised bands. A Few marks to boards. Top portion of front free endpaper has been removed by tearing. Internally, firmly bound. Pages are generally bright with a small amount of age toning to edges. The odd spot throughout.

Overall: Very Good

Delivery & payment

We send all of our books via courier which is a fully tracked and insured service. In our experience we find this to be the most reliable and quickest form of delivery. Our primary courier is DHL, but we are able to accommodate special requests if required, including postal delivery for items under 2kg. See More Details
